name: uncooperativeness
content:
Add to word list

the quality of being uncooperative (= not willing to work with or be helpful to people): Uncooperativeness may be the first sign that the patient has given up and really wants to die. I will not stand any indifference or uncooperativeness on your part. See
uncooperative
More examplesFewer examplesTheir officers might experience impatience at their collective uncooperativeness.The bureaucracy is stuck in its habit of uncooperativeness toward foreign journalists.7 of 28 patients were characterized by high uncooperativeness.
